title: Business Finance Analyst, Strategic Pricing (2026 New College Graduate)
description: About GlobalFoundries: GlobalFoundries is a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world's most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GlobalFoundries makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. For more information, visit www.gf.com. New College Graduates Overview : We offer many full-time employment paths for recent graduates, which provide accelerated training in a fast-paced work environment, cross-functional working opportunities, and talent mobility. New college graduates are provided with mentorship, networking, and leadership opportunities, which give our new team members life-long connections and skills. Summary of Role: This Pricing role sits within the Strategic Finance & Operations function at GlobalFoundries. Main responsibilities are around execution of pricing situations through business, customer and deal analyses and implementation of new strategic initiatives. This is a high profile and rapidly growing team within GlobalFoundries that works directly with sales, product and market intelligence teams to continuously guide the business towards beneficial market and customer opportunities. Essential Responsibilities: Conduct in-depth analysis of pricing models, market trends, customer behavior, and competitive positioning to inform strategic pricing decisions Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Product Finance, Sales, Strategic Finance) to implement pricing strategies that align with business goals and respond to dynamic market conditions Communicate pricing strategies, policies and guidelines to internal stakeholders and ensure transparency and alignment across the organization. Evaluate pricing deal outcomes and recommend adjustments to ensure competitiveness and profitability across product lines and customer segments. Contribute to cross-functional stakeholders in analyzing pricing structures, market trends, competition dynamics, and customer behavior to develop comprehensive view and make data-driven pricing decisions. Participate in quoting workflows, refresh grid pricing and discount levels, and support escalated quote reviews. Utilize AI tools to accelerate pricing analysis, automate reporting, and enhance analytical capabilities Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in pricing, and continuously innovate and improve pricing processes and methodologies. Other Responsibilities: Excellent communication and collaboration skills: Ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams incl. senior management and communicate pricing strategies and decisions to internal stakeholders and customers. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: Ability to analyze data and market trends to make informed pricing decisions. Strategic thinking: Ability to develop and implement pricing strategies that align with the company's goals and objectives. Business acumen: Understanding of the business dynamics, market trends, competition, and customer behavior to make data-driven pricing decisions. Adaptability: Ability to adapt to changes in the market and adjust pricing strategies as needed. Experience with pricing software and tools: Familiarity with pricing software and tools can help streamline the pricing process and improve accuracy. title: Associate Business Analyst - Client Success
description: Equus Software has been recognized by Inc. 5000 as one of the fastest growing privately held companies in the United States. We continue to expand with offices in Denver, Dallas, Lisbon, London and Manila. Our relentless focus on creating innovative global workforce management solutions has helped us become the market leader in our industry. Our platform interacts with uniquely configured Implementation stacks which are inherently varied and complex. Our customers cover diverse industries and they rely on Equus Software to train them on deploying our Global Mobility software. We are a product and customer-focused company, and that comes across in our A-Player Traits which drive both how we work and who we hire. ABOUT THE ROLE As an Associate Business Analyst at Equus Software, you will be part of the Global Client Success team. The focus of the role is to provide innovative solutions and solve problems to meet the client's technical requirements working as a team. You will do this by supporting a team of business and senior business analysts. You will assist the team in providing solutions through the onboarding of the Equus Workforce Solutions which require ongoing technical configuration, troubleshooting, replication of application issues, testing of system upgrades, as well as keeping current on the most recent application enhancements. If you're a recent graduate with a strong desire to learn, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to excellence, we encourage you to apply for this exciting entry-level Associate Business Analyst opportunity. This position will be on a hybrid work set-up, minimum 2 times/week in the Plano office. RESPONSIBILITIES Ability to effectively problem-solve issues to resolution, this will require the ability to partner with your team for additional support when needed. Skilled in organizing client technical information during client meetings by taking meeting minutes/notes, detailing exact technical specifications. Able to perform requirement analysis, configuration, testing and issue resolution. When requested, participate, or assist in the preparation of client webinars, conferences, demos, and other presentations to both clients and internal Equus team. Decipher technical client build document requirements by writing test plans and test cases for quality assurance and user acceptance, including conducting QA testing and reporting results. Gain exposure to Equus products and client projects; both technical and functional, with hands-on assignments. Develops strong working relationships with clients and internal teams. May at times participate in a quarterly live chat rotation with other team members to provide exceptional service to our clients who are requesting online help. Participate in team standups and meetings. Participate in client working sessions. Participate in other Equus internal initiatives. Seek out information about the global mobility industry and software industries and apply that knowledge to day-to-day activities. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related discipline from an accredited college/university. Analytical and conceptual thinking skills. Efficiently handle data-intensive and time-sensitive tasks. Excellent verbal and written communication, as well as organizational skills to effectively communicate and interact with all levels within the Equus organization. Ability to quickly understand our client needs and technical expectations both verbally and written. Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines by demonstrated organizational and time management skills. Strong analytical and detail-oriented skills required. Team player with a positive attitude required. Desired: Technical background with understanding and/or experience in software development and/or web technology. TECHNICAL SKILLS Required: experience with multiple software and system-based applications; Microsoft Office applications. Advanced excel knowledge, desired but not required. Knowledge and experience using Atlassian products: Confluence and Jira applications, desired but not required. Learned applications: Slack, ClickTime, Kantata, 15five. KnowBe4. Working or basic knowledge: Structured query language writing / SQL Server Management Studio understanding. WHY YOU WANT TO WORK HERE Learn best practices and become a SME with our technology. Great location! Plano office at Granite Park. Great people. We only hire the best which means you're working with the best! Nice office, relaxed and collaborative atmosphere with a casual dress code. We've been serving clients for over 20 years, and we're growing fast. You'll be a part of a team that configures software to deliver quickly and effectively. Always learning something new! You will develop a wide variety of skills, and will become a subject matter expert in your first year. Great salary and benefits. We have highly competitive salaries and offer great bonuses for exceptional contributors. We have enterprise-class benefits. Take advantage of Innovation Day with every release. Play with whatever technology you want, learn what you want, try out something new! You will get to present it to the company. Many innovations have made it into our products! **No sponsorships available.

title: Root Cause Analyst
description: Senior Root Cause Analysis (RCA) Analyst Location: Dallas, TX Long term contact Description: Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field. 10+ years of experience in technology operations or service management. 3+ years of hands-on experience in RCA methodologies, reporting, problem management. Knowledge of infrastructure, cloud platforms, and application support. Exposure to ITIL framework and best practices and strong documentation Proficiency in technology service management tools (e.g., Jira Service Management). Excellent communication, analytical, and stakeholder management Nice to have skills: Analyze incident trends and recurring issues to identify underlying problems. Conduct Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and documenting findings. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement corrective actions. Support the Problem Management Lead in tracking and reporting problem metrics. Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives across technology operations. Ensure compliance with internal standards and ITIL best practices. Job Type: Contract Pay: $29.30 - $38.28 per hour Work Location: In person

title: IT Business Analyst (TX537601551)
description: IT Business Analyst (TX537601551) Job Details: Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with industry standard business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. The RMA seeks highly qualified candidates to fill the Business Analyst position within the Environmental Epidemiology and Disease Registries Section. This position will perform senior level consultative services and technical assistance work in the area of analysis for program related activities. Work involves analyzing priority initiatives and special projects utilizing business analysis best practices in coordination with agency business and program units. Duties include: assessing, analyzing, researching, facilitating and documenting requirements, assuring the use of best practices and standards, assisting in the coordination and optimization of operations and program functions and providing recommendations. This position is responsible for assisting with the facilitation and analysis across numerous related initiatives and leading special projects as assigned by agency leadership. These responsibilities include: developing business analysis tools; defining requirements; reporting progress on key projects to management; providing recommendations to agency leadership. This position will also work with staff to initiate, facilitate or participate in projects to maximize the success of multiple and diverse projects. Works under limited direction with extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary Pay: $77.00 - $82.00 per hour Work Location: In person

title: Business Analyst 3
description: Working Title: Business Analyst 3 Location will be at - 701 W. 51st, Austin, Texas 78751 – On Site – Local only Duration : 10 Months Contract I. DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs. Formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies. Experienced with business process reengineering and identifying new applications of technology to business problems to make business more effective. Familiar with industry standard business process mapping, and reengineering. Prepares solution options, risk identification, and financial analyses such as cost/benefit, ROI, buy/build, etc. Writes detailed description of user needs, program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs. The Business Automation Support (BAS) unit within the Medicaid and CHIP Services (MCS) Department oversees Texas Medicaid & Healthcare Partnership (TMHP) systems and related support activities. BAS provides oversight of LTC program systems, which supports LTC providers for services delivered to individuals; modifications and updates to TMHP vendor systems; and encounter data and MCO file support and coordination. A Business Analyst (BA) is needed to support the legislatively approved Provider Enrollment and Management System (PEMS) projects. PEMS is a centralized electronic method for Medicaid and non-Medicaid program providers interested in enrolling to submit a single application, in a single location (a web portal), to be accepted and processed by a single entity based on their National Provider Identifier (NPI). HHSC would like to make significant changes to PEMS to improve the provider experience and system functionality. The Worker will serve as a Business Analyst/Product Owner for the PEMS project and support activities as needed. The Worker will work directly with internal units (Provider Services); TMHP technical sprint teams; and business users to provide subject matter expertise, perform critical analysis, ensure requirements are gathered that meet the functional needs and assist in creating and maintaining a prioritized and healthy backlog as directed by the legislative mandate. The Worker will be responsible for delivering quality products that meet the state's desired operational and technical requirements. The worker will have considerable latitude to use their experience and judgement to ensure successful completion of their assigned tasks. The Worker will be required to multi-task, analyze priorities, communicate clearly, and set expectations for the phases of the project. The Worker will be responsible for communicating with multiple internal and external stakeholders including program and technical staff, and other contracted and vendor resources. The Worker will participate in meetings, track deliverables and schedules, and alert management of any issues that may impact providers. The services to be provided include, but are not limited to the following: A. Analyzes program policies, procedures, and processes to determine the impact on business systems and functional areas. B. Analyzes and reviews system, data, and project deliverables such as business user requirements, design documentation, test plans, and risk assessment plans to ensure business and technical requirements are met. C. Works with program area staff to solicit, analyze and document business processes and requirements. D. Acts as a liaison between state staff and vendors to translate operational and business requirements to vendors. E. Serves as the Product Owner for an Agile team, including working with Agile/Scrum teams of contracted software vendors to implement system changes. F. Analyzes and writes User Stories with Acceptance Criteria based on business needs and according to the Agile methodology. G. Develops and maintains business user test scenarios and participates in systems and user acceptance testing. H. Creates use case scenarios, test plans, and exit criteria that accurately map back to the documented business requirements or user stories. I. Reviews, analyzes and executes test cases with a formal testing tool. J. Tracks, documents and reports the status of testing. K. Evaluates proposed test strategies to ensure appropriate test coverage. L. Identifies potential project risks and issues and develops mitigation strategies, M. Reports project status to management on established timelines. N. Documents action items and business decisions. O. Conducts meetings and/or presentation tasks as needed. P. Manages schedule for deliverables as established. Q. Other duties as assigned related to PEMS projects. II. CANDIDATE SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Requirements: Candidates that do not meet or exceed the minimum stated requirements (skills/experience) will be displayed to customers but may not be chosen for this opportunity. Required Experience (8+ Years Each) Business Analyst and Agile Product Owner experience. Hands-on experience working in Agile software development environments . Performing complex business analysis and creating technical documentation . Reporting project status to leadership, including risks, issues, blockers, and key decisions. Identifying project risks and issues , and developing/implementing mitigation plans. Strong written and verbal communication skills , including documenting requirements, deliverables, test scenarios, and project updates. Gathering, validating, and documenting business requirements , and translating them into technical solutions . Reviewing and approving complex technical user/system requirements created by vendors. Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools (Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint). Coordinating and developing test plans, test strategies, exit criteria, and test scenarios . Executing detailed test cases in complex software environments. Using test management software . Using Microsoft Project or other project management software. Approving and prioritizing user stories based on stakeholder input and SME expertise. Experience with Medicaid systems and processes . Experience in claims processing . Preferred Experience Knowledge of Texas Medicaid programs (4+ years preferred). Experience with the Project Enrollment and Management Systems (PEMS) project (2+ years preferred). Job Type: Contract Pay: $75,338.12 - $90,729.77 per year Work Location: In person
parsed_skills: agile, communication, excel, leadership, presentation, project management, scrum

title: Data Analyst - Junior
description: Job Summary We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. You will work closely with various departments to identify trends and insights that can help drive business decisions. A strong background in data analysis, along with proficiency in relevant tools and programming languages, is essential for success in this role. Duties Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decisions. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and Looker. Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an Agile environment to gather requirements and deliver actionable insights. Utilize SQL for querying databases and performing data extraction tasks. Design and implement ETL processes to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Conduct business analysis to understand the needs of stakeholders and translate them into technical requirements. Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) by providing data-driven insights throughout project phases. Create visual representations of data findings using tools like Visio for effective communication of results. Employ programming languages such as Python, R, VBA, or Bash (Unix shell) for data manipulation and analysis tasks. Assist in database design and management using Microsoft SQL Server or Oracle. Experience Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role. Strong proficiency in data analysis skills with a solid understanding of analytics concepts. Familiarity with project management methodologies and tools. Experience with linked data concepts is a plus. Knowledge of Talend or other ETL tools is advantageous. Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment. Excellent problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail. Join us in leveraging data to drive impactful business decisions! Job Type: Full-time Pay: $75,246.10 - $90,618.96 per year Work Location: In person

title: Business Analyst III - BA 25-32999
description: Job Title: Business Analyst III Location: Austin, TX (Onsite Only) Duration: 8 Months Position Overview We are seeking a highly experienced Business Analyst III to support enterprise-level initiatives through advanced analysis, documentation, and business process optimization. The ideal candidate has strong consultative skills, excels at evaluating business systems and user needs, and can provide strategic recommendations to leadership. This role requires extensive experience with business process mapping, requirements gathering, and developing solution options in alignment with organizational goals. The Business Analyst will work under limited supervision with significant latitude for independent judgment and decision-making. Key Responsibilities Review, analyze, and evaluate business systems and user needs. Formulate business and technical solutions that align with organizational strategies. Conduct business process reengineering, mapping, gap analysis, and efficiency assessments. Prepare cost/benefit analyses, ROI evaluations, risk assessments, and solution recommendations. Document detailed user requirements, program functions, and system workflows. Assess and analyze priority initiatives and special projects across multiple business units. Develop business analysis tools, templates, and best practices. Facilitate meetings with stakeholders to gather and document requirements. Provide detailed reports, findings, and recommendations to executive leadership. Support project teams with SDLC documentation including requirements, design artifacts, test cases, and use cases. Participate in the planning and coordination of operational and program improvements. Lead or support special projects as assigned. Required Skills & Experience 8+ years of experience researching, gathering, correlating, and analyzing system requirements. 8+ years of experience developing reports that identify functional gaps and operational inefficiencies. 8+ years of experience creating as-is and to-be process models and identifying process improvements. 8+ years of experience analyzing program policies and procedures for system impact. 8+ years of experience partnering with functional teams to understand unmet business and technical needs. Preferred Skills & Experience 5+ years of experience building strong stakeholder relationships and conducting advanced requirements elicitation. 5+ years of experience developing SDLC documentation such as gap analyses, roadmaps, requirement specs, design documents, test cases, and use cases. 1+ year of UX design experience.

title: Analyst, Revenue Management Business Analytics
description: ABOUT GREYSTAR Greystar is a leading, fully integrated global real estate platform offering expertise in property management, investment management, development, and construction services in institutional-quality rental housing. Headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina, Greystar manages and operates over $300 billion of real estate in more than 250 markets globally with offices throughout North America, Europe, South America, and the Asia-Pacific region. Greystar is the largest operator of apartments in the United States, managing over 1,000,000 units/beds globally. Across its platforms, Greystar has nearly $79 billion of assets under management, including over $35 billion of development assets and over $30 billion of regulatory assets under management. Greystar was founded by Bob Faith in 1993 to become a provider of world-class service in the rental residential real estate business. To learn more, visit www.greystar.com. JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY The Analyst, Revenue Management Business Analytics accesses revenue management and business data from multiple sources, and compiles, analyzes, and generates standard and custom revenue management reports, case studies, and market and performance trends to support the ongoing operation and administration of the Revenue Management function. The position assists in accessing revenue management and other database platforms to track the Revenue Management function's performance on established key performance indicators, and provides real estate operations leaders, new business development, and other stakeholders with supporting narratives, graphics, case studies, and other analytics to enable data-driven response strategies and decision-making. JOB DESCRIPTION Assist in creating, developing, and distributing the standard and custom Revenue Management function's reporting capabilities by accessing, compiling, and analyzing data from multiple platforms and sources and generating compelling reporting packages, case studies, graphics, market, and performance trends. Access data from multiple platforms and databases to track the function's performance on established key performance indicators, and provide real estate operations leaders, new business development teams, and leaders within the Revenue Management function with reporting and narratives that enable effective response strategies, decision-making, and improved revenue management systems performance. Create and distribute all of the Revenue Management function's monthly regular and standard reporting, recommend changes and additions to the reporting package to enhance reporting capabilities and improve support to the business, and participate in financial and performance review calls as required to support stakeholder decision-making. Assist in executing and completing tasks and activities associated with the reconciliation of revenue management vendor invoices and the preparation and distribution of monthly property and client billing. Generate and disseminate profitability reports by product type and Region, respond to reporting questions and information requests from clients and real estate operations leaders, and engage with Revenue Management leaders as needed to track, manage, and respond to changes that may impact achievement of targeted revenue and profitability goals. Look for opportunities to improve or enhance the services and customer support experience provided by the Revenue Management function, suggest or recommend innovations and new technologies in the discipline, make recommendations for streamlining processes, reducing costs, and driving efficiencies, and participate in and support projects, initiatives, and other efforts owned by the Revenue Management function. Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required Bachelor's degree or comparable experience in real estate property management operations, technology and systems, data analytics, general business, or a related field. A working knowledge of multifamily property management operations and fundamental knowledge of data management systems, such as Power BI, and revenue management technologies and systems is helpful. Proven success and experience in using advanced functions of Excel, such as pivot tables, and some knowledge and experience in using key functions within business analytics platforms, such as Power Query, Xlookup, IFS, DAX, and Pagnaed Report Builder. Solid ability to access, analyze, and make objective interpretations of market and economic data, and create compelling reporting packages, graphic interpretations and illustrations, narratives, case studies and white papers, and other supporting documents for tracking financial and operational performance and enabling sales and business development strategies and practices. Good process management skills and ability to track, manage, and complete multiple activities, tasks, and processes according to specified timelines, legal standards, and defined outcomes. Planning and organizing skills are essential, and ability to manage several priorities simultaneously is critical. Skilled in managing personal productivity, meeting deadlines, and coping and managing through quickly changing priorities and environments. Demonstrated proficiency in solving problems, thinking strategically and creatively, and resolving conflicts is required. Solid written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills, with a strong customer-centric orientation. Able to build and maintain productive relationships with real estate operations leaders and client services and new business development professions, and experience in interacting with external clients and vendors and suppliers is preferred. Skilled and comfortable in using digital and online software and apps to accomplish work, manage and organize time, and communicate, including the ability to use Microsoft products such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and TEAMS, email, and virtual meeting software. Ability to quickly learn how to use the Company's various data management platforms and other systems that support new business development, such as Salesforce. #LI-RS1 Additional Compensation : Many factors go into determining employee pay within the posted range including business requirements, prior experience, current skills and geographical location. Corporate Positions : In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible to participate in a quarterly or annual bonus program based on individual and company performance. Onsite Property Positions : In addition to the base salary, this role may be eligible to participate in weekly, monthly, and/or quarterly bonus programs. Robust Benefits Offered*: Competitive Medical, Dental, Vision, and Disability & Life insurance benefits. Low (free basic) employee Medical costs for employee-only coverage; costs discounted after 3 and 5 years of service. Generous Paid Time off. All new hires start with 15 days of vacation, 4 personal days, 10 sick days, and 11 paid holidays. Plus your birthday off after 1 year of service! Additional vacation accrued with tenure. For onsite team members, onsite housing discount at Greystar-managed communities are available subject to discount and unit availability. 6-Week Paid Sabbatical after 10 years of service (and every 5 years thereafter). 401(k) with Company Match up to 6% of pay after 6 months of service. Paid Parental Leave and lifetime Fertility Benefit reimbursement up to $10,000 (includes adoption or surrogacy). Employee Assistance Program. Critical Illness, Accident, Hospital Indemnity, Pet Insurance and Legal Plans. Charitable giving program and benefits. Benefits offered for full-time employees. For Union and Prevailing Wage roles, compensation and benefits may vary from the listed information above due to Collective Bargaining Agreements and/or local governing authority. Greystar will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

title: Associate Analyst, Patient Payments
description: Description: Now is the time to join PDS Health. You will have opportunities to learn new skills from our team of experienced professionals. If you're ready to take your career to the next level and gain valuable experience, apply today! Overview: The Associate Analyst, Orthodontic Payment Solutions is responsible for supporting the Orthodontic ROC team through data analysis, research, and reporting to drive operational efficiency and performance improvements. Key responsibilities include conducting research to identify discrepancies in reporting, assisting in monitoring work queue volume and trends, and ensuring alignment with standard operating procedures through monthly audits. The role also involves developing and maintaining training programs, coaching team members, and serving as a subject matter expert to provide actionable insights and recommendations to leadership. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate across teams to resolve issues, improve processes, and contribute to department objectives. Responsibilities Conduct research to identify, resolve and provide insight for department reporting and performance discrepancies or anomalies. Assist in monitoring work queue volume, trends, and communicate findings to leadership. Monthly account audits to determine alignment with standard operating procedures. Summarizes, analyzes, and reports findings to leadership for ongoing transparency and improvement. Assessing functionality and relevancy of quality improvement tools and processes. Continuous review of orthodontic functions and processes to identify and resolve any noticeable patterns of errors by conferring with the management team. Draw up audit findings in a professional manner and prepare to discuss with team members and management. Serve as a subject matter expert and makes recommendations aligned with department and company objectives. Maintain training records and prepare reports on training outcomes and progress. Assist in the development and maintenance of the training program and support offshore/onshore team members through effective leadership, coaching, and mentoring. Other duties as assigned by management. Qualifications 3-4+ years of related experience. Experience working in Epic Systems. Strong computer and data entry skills with competent knowledge of Microsoft Word, Outlook and Excel software applications. Preferred Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college in quantitative discipline or related field. Strong presentation skills, excellent interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Ability to multi-task effectively without compromising the quality of the work. Ability to draw valid conclusions, apply sound judgement in making decisions, and to make decisions under pressure. Ability to interpret and apply policies and procedures. Display independent judgement by willingness to make timely and accurate decisions based on available information. Analytical skills to synthesize complex or diverse information. Ability to research information and analyze data to arrive at valid conclusions, recommendations, and plans of action. Detail oriented, organized, process focused, problem solver, proactive, goal driven, and ambitious. Self-motivated, reliable individual capable of working independently as well as part of a team. Ability to communicate effectively and present information, both verbally and in writing, to management and offshore teams. Demonstrated ability to manage projects and prioritize tasks effectively. Ability to translate vision into action, leading change, and inspiring people to get results. Demonstrate strong facilitation and collaboration skills. Benefits Medical, dental, and vision insurance Paid time off Tuition Reimbursement 401K Paid time to volunteer in your local community ‎ : PDS Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are united in our mission to create healthier and happier team members. Salary Information: $24.60-$33.40 / Hourly

title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Houston Market - Aramark Sports & Entertainment
description: Job Description The Data Science division is the epicenter of data analytics, uncovering impactful insights that put Aramark clients in the sports and entertainment industry ahead of the curve. Using leading-edge technology and analytics, Data Science synthesizes operational and consumer data to optimize strategies that enhance the guest hospitality experience and blaze a trail for innovation. Through continuous expansion of analytical capabilities and a comprehensive method of understanding the industry at large, Data Science harnesses the power of data as the most strategic asset in maximizing value for consumers, operators, and businesses alike. Job Responsibilities We are seeking a dynamic and curious BI Analyst to join our team. This role blends analytical insight with scalable BI development. You will analyze trends and uncover insights to drive local business value, while also designing and building enterprise-ready solutions such as dashboards, AI agents, and operational tools using Power BI and other technologies. The ideal candidate thrives at the intersection of data storytelling and technical innovation, bringing curiosity and initiative to both local and enterprise projects. This is a hybrid role based in the Houston area, with 2?3 days per week on-site at local venues (NRG Park, Daikin Park, Cynthia Woods Mitchell Pavilion, Constellation Field) and 2?3 days remote, focused on strategic initiatives. The ideal candidate is independent, self-motivated, and intellectually curious. This candidate is someone who proactively seeks out opportunities, asks the right questions, and takes initiative to turn insights into action. title: Reporting Analyst
description: Location: Brookshire Job Description: The Reporting Analyst supports data-driven decision making across the organization by developing, maintaining, and improving critical operational, financial, supply-chain, and workforce reporting. This role works closely with owners, directors, and managers to collect, verify, analyze, and present information that enhances visibility, strengthens accountability, and supports strategic and tactical actions. The Reporting Analyst creates standardized reporting tools, dashboards, and automated data flows; ensures data accuracy and integrity; identifies trends; and provides clear insights that improve capability, capacity, productivity, quality, and customer satisfaction. The role integrates systems with business processes, supports performance measurement initiatives, and contributes to continuous improvement across the company. Keu Attributes for Success High integrity and commitment to accuracy. Curiosity and willingness to dig into data and uncover root causes. Ability to bridge technical data and real-world operations. Collaborative approach with strong customer-service orientation toward internal stakeholders. Continuous improvement mindset aligned with organizational goals. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following: Collect, validate, and analyze data from multiple internal systems such as our ERP, Global Shop Solutions (GSS) to generate accurate and timely reports. Develop, maintain, and improve dashboards, KPIs, scorecards, and automated reporting solutions for leadership and department managers. Translate complex data sets into clear, actionable insights that support operational excellence, supply chain performance, production planning, and quality management. Partner with stakeholders to understand reporting needs and develop standardized templates and recurring reports. Identify reporting gaps or data integrity issues; recommend and implement improvements to enhance data quality, consistency, and reliability. Analyze trends in production throughput, labor performance, machine utilization, inventory accuracy, supplier performance, and scrap/rework. Support corrective action, continuous improvement, and root-cause analysis initiatives with data-driven evidence. Build automated processes that simplify data extraction, transformation, and distribution. Maintain documentation of datasets, definitions, data sources, and reporting procedures. Support ad-hoc analysis requests, special projects, and senior leadership initiatives requiring accurate and timely reporting. Protect sensitive information in compliance with CUI, ITAR, company policies, and data governance requirements. Job Requirements and Qualifications: Skills Strong analytical and quantitative skills; able to interpret large, complex data sets. Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, Power Query, complex formulas, lookups). Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI or similar). Strong understanding of database structures, data flows, and system integrations. Ability to translate raw data into meaningful metrics, trends, and recommendations. Highly organized with strong attention to detail and a focus on data accuracy. Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present findings to management and plant leadership Ability to manage multiple priorities, meet deadlines, and adapt to evolving business needs. Problem-solving mindset with a continuous-improvement approach. Ability to work independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams. Knowledge and Experience Working knowledge of ERP/MRP systems (Epicor, SAP, Oracle, or similar). Extensive knowledge of GSS is a plus. Understanding of manufacturing, production processes, or supply chain workflows. Familiarity with KPI development, operational metrics, and performance measurement. Basic understanding of aerospace industry requirements, including quality systems (AS9100) and compliance expectations (ITAR), is a plus. Understanding of data governance, confidentiality requirements, and reporting controls. 2–5 years of experience in reporting, data analysis, business analytics, or a related field. Experience in manufacturing, aerospace, engineering, or industrial environments strongly preferred. Demonstrated experience creating dashboards, automated reports, and analytical tools. Experience supporting operational and cross-functional teams using data-driven insights. Work Eligibility (ITAR): This position must meet Export Control compliance requirements, therefore a "US Person" as defined by 22 C.F.R. § 120.15 is required. "US Person" includes US Citizen, lawful permanent resident or persons with protected status. Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status. Thank you for your interest. Due to the volume of applications, only applicants chosen for further consideration will be contacted. While we appreciate and value our staffing partners, we do not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. Thomas Instrument Inc. will not be responsible for paying agency fees for any individual to whom an agency has sent an unsolicited resume Thomas Instrument is an EEO employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, veteran status, medical condition (GINA), or disability.

title: Business Analyst III - BA 25-32999
description: Job Title: Business Analyst III Location: Austin, TX (Onsite Only) Duration: 8 Months Position Overview We are seeking a highly experienced Business Analyst III to support enterprise-level initiatives through advanced analysis, documentation, and business process optimization. The ideal candidate has strong consultative skills, excels at evaluating business systems and user needs, and can provide strategic recommendations to leadership. This role requires extensive experience with business process mapping, requirements gathering, and developing solution options in alignment with organizational goals. The Business Analyst will work under limited supervision with significant latitude for independent judgment and decision-making. Key Responsibilities Review, analyze, and evaluate business systems and user needs. Formulate business and technical solutions that align with organizational strategies. Conduct business process reengineering, mapping, gap analysis, and efficiency assessments. Prepare cost/benefit analyses, ROI evaluations, risk assessments, and solution recommendations. Document detailed user requirements, program functions, and system workflows. Assess and analyze priority initiatives and special projects across multiple business units. Develop business analysis tools, templates, and best practices. Facilitate meetings with stakeholders to gather and document requirements. Provide detailed reports, findings, and recommendations to executive leadership. Support project teams with SDLC documentation including requirements, design artifacts, test cases, and use cases. Participate in the planning and coordination of operational and program improvements. Lead or support special projects as assigned. Required Skills & Experience 8+ years of experience researching, gathering, correlating, and analyzing system requirements. 8+ years of experience developing reports that identify functional gaps and operational inefficiencies. 8+ years of experience creating as-is and to-be process models and identifying process improvements. 8+ years of experience analyzing program policies and procedures for system impact. 8+ years of experience partnering with functional teams to understand unmet business and technical needs. Preferred Skills & Experience 5+ years of experience building strong stakeholder relationships and conducting advanced requirements elicitation. 5+ years of experience developing SDLC documentation such as gap analyses, roadmaps, requirement specs, design documents, test cases, and use cases. 1+ year of UX design experience.

title: Business Analyst Consultant
description: Job Description: The Role As a Business Analyst Consultant within the Core Wealth Platform Product Area, you will support multiple platform team initiatives aimed at growing our core business and scaling our technology platforms. You are a detail-oriented analyst, who enjoys technology and innovation, with a natural curiosity and a passion for problem solving. You seek opportunity for hands-on delivery work, and value collaborative partnerships, commitment to team and Owning the Outcome. The role will focus on the development and implementation of Investment Exposure and Risk Analytics to help our Brokerage, Wealth, and Workplace customers reach their financial goals. This is part of a larger strategic initiative to build an Insights platform of the future, with flexibility and scale to meet our growing consumers' needs. This position combines big-picture vision with practical execution, making it an exciting opportunity for candidates passionate about innovation and financial planning thru digital financial technology. Responsibilities include: Conducting thorough analysis of customer needs, business processes, and technical capabilities to create and prioritize solutions. Collaborating closely with partners to drive capture requirements, documentation and informing the path and implementation plan. Working closely with systems analysts researching data, accessing APIs. Participating in development cycles, balancing pace over perfection. The Expertise and Skills You Bring Bachelor's degree with 8+ years of experience or master's degree with 6+ years. Experience within the Financial Services industry, specifically investment performance and analytics preferred Growth mindset and willingness to learn and adapt. Desire to work collaboratively in an cross functional team. Strong execution background with the ability to multi-task and prioritize for efficiency and business need. Proven ability to write business requirements, identify use cases with attention to detail. You have demonstrated strong verbal and written communication skills and bring an intellectually curious approach day in and day out Ability to collaboratively build and present a compelling story based on data and analysis Data/API query a plus (JSON editor, BRUNO, SQL/SQL Dev. The Team You will be a member of the Investment Exposure and Risk Analytics & Insights team that is part of the Core Wealth Platform Product Area. Your primary focus will be developing and supporting investment insights and analytics for our Wealth, Brokerage and Workplace customers. In this role you will partner with a variety of key stakeholders including other teams within the Product Area, Wealth Solutions, Brokerage, Workplace and Wealth Technology partners. You will learn best in class delivery process to drive scale and operational efficiency. Fidelity's hybrid working model blends the best of both onsite and offsite work experiences. Working onsite is important for our business strategy and our culture. We also value the benefits that working offsite offers associates. Most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite every other week (all business days, M-F) in a Fidelity office. Note: If you are a FINRA registered internal employee who is considering moving to a non-licensed role, you may want to proactively have a conversation with the hiring manger to understand the potential impact to your registrations before a final hiring decision is made. Note: Fidelity will not provide immigration sponsorship for this position. Certifications: Category: Product Management Most roles at Fidelity are Hybrid, requiring associates to work onsite every other week (all business days, M-F) in a Fidelity office. This does not apply to Remote or fully Onsite roles. Please be advised that Fidelity's business is governed by the provisions of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Investment Advisers Act of 1940, the Investment Company Act of 1940, ERISA, numerous state laws governing securities, investment and retirement-related financial activities and the rules and regulations of numerous self-regulatory organizations, including FINRA, among others. title: Field Operations Analyst
description: We are Farmers! We are… more than just your favorite commercials. At Farmers, we strive to deliver peace of mind to our customers by providing protection and comprehensive advice and delivering in the moments of truth. That means having people who can help us meet changing customer and business needs. Farmers high-performance culture is focused on results and the people who achieve them. We hold ourselves and others accountable for sustainably growing the business and each other. We seek solutions, own our actions, and grow through discomfort. We see setbacks as opportunities while continuously asking ourselves how we impact our customers. Farmers is an award winning, equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of an inclusive workforce. We are dedicated to supporting the well-being of our people through our extensive suite of benefits, as well as the well-being of the communities we serve through employee volunteer programs and nonprofit partnerships. Helping others in their time of need isn't just our business – it's our culture! To learn more about our high-performance culture and open opportunities, check out www.Farmers.com/careers/corporate and be sure to follow us on Instagram, LinkedIn, and TikTok. Workplace: Remote (ideal candidates lives in GA, FL, TN, TX) Farmers believes in a culture of collaboration, creativity, and innovation, which thrives when we have the ability to work flexibly in a virtual setting as well as the opportunity to be together in person. Our hybrid work environment combines the best of both worlds with at least three (3) days in office and up to two (2) days virtual for employees who live within fifty (50) miles of a Farmers corporate office. Applicants beyond fifty (50) miles may still be considered. Job Summary This role provides operational and analytical support for territory leadership to optimize the implementation and performance of territory initiatives. Performs work with limited direction or guidance. Essential Job Functions Conducts market research, analyzes data, and provides actionable insights and recommendations related to field operations such as sales performance, agent productivity, customer experience, and market trends to territory and market leadership. Develops recommendations to improve sales productivity and to drive efficiencies. Coordinates product rollouts, sales initiatives, communication strategies, technology integration, process optimization, and profitability actions. Assists territory and market leadership with project management, presentation preparation, and communication initiatives. Supports leadership on ad-hoc projects including problem-resolution as assigned. Works across stakeholders to coordinate territory and market meetings including meeting agendas, communication, logistics, speakers, and content. Performs other duties as assigned. Physical Actions This role, whether performed virtually or in an office setting, will include normal and customary distractions, noise, and interruptions. Sits or stands for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Occasionally reaches overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Occasionally moves, lifts, carries, and places objects and supplies weighing 0-10 pounds without assistance. Listens to, interprets, and differentiates auditory information (example others speaking) at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Visually verifies and reads information. Visually locates material, resources and other objects. Ability to continuously operate a computer for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Physical dexterity sufficient to use hands, arms, and shoulders repetitively to operate keyboard and other office equipment up to a full work shift. Education Requirements High School Diploma or equivalent required. Bachelors degree preferred. Experience Requirements 3-5 years of experience in insurance field operations, marketing or similar role required. Experience with data analysis preferred. Proficient in Excel Sharepoint (or related cloud-based storing system) preferred Additional Qualification Benefits Farmers offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, qualifications and location. Medical Dental Vision Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts Life Insurance Paid Time Off Job Location(s): Virtual: candidate must reside in FL, GA, TX, TN Anticipated application deadline: At Farmers, the recruitment process is designed to ensure that we find the best talent to join our team. As part of this process, we typically close open positions within 8 to 21 days after posting. If you are interested in any of our open positions, we encourage you to submit your application promptly. Farmers will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in accordance with the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance or other applicable law. Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1033, Farmers is prohibited from employing any individual who has been convicted of any criminal felony involving dishonesty or a breach of trust without prior written consent from the state Department of Insurance. It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability. title: BI Data Analyst, Specialist
description: Data analyst- Join the fast-paced world of IT operations as an analyst developing insights and AI for how the entire enterprise experiences technology! Understand how our clients and business partners are impacted by IT outages and degradations. Learn how IT assets, applications, and their inter-workings fuel the business! Help defend our product owners from risk with technical debt data and controls reporting. If you enjoy working with data and are looking to be engaged with a collaborative team of analysts, this is for you! Core Responsibilities: 1. Engages with internal partners to understand business strategy, questions, and goals. Brings structure to business requests, translates requirements into an analytical project approach, and supports projects through completion. 2. Acquires and compiles structured and unstructured data and verifies its quality, accuracy and reasonableness. 3. Performs analyses of historical data to surface trends and insights using analytical methods. 4. Prepares and delivers visualizations and internal presentations that translate analytic insights into tangible, actionable solutions for business partners to implement. 5. May own and manage recurring analytic or reporting processes. 6. Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned. Qualifications 3 years related work experience. Experience utilizing Python Experience utilizing SQL Experience with Data Modeling and Visualization Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of training and experience. Preferences: Experience working with AWS (Sagemaker, S3, etc...) Interested in learning machine learning and AI Special Factors Sponsorship Vanguard is not offering visa sponsorship for this position. About Vanguard At Vanguard, we don't just have a mission—we're on a mission. To work for the long-term financial wellbeing of our clients. To lead through product and services that transform our clients' lives. To learn and develop our skills as individuals and as a team. From Malvern to Melbourne, our mission drives us forward and inspires us to be our best. How We Work Vanguard has implemented a hybrid working model for the majority of our crew members, designed to capture the benefits of enhanced flexibility while enabling in-person learning, collaboration, and connection. We believe our mission-driven and highly collaborative culture is a critical enabler to support long-term client outcomes and enrich the employee experience.
company_description: Founded in 1975, Vanguard established a new brand of investment management firm - one owned by our investors, not private parties or shareholders.

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: When you're the best, we're the best. We instill an environment where employees feel engaged, satisfied and able to contribute their unique skills and talents while living and working as their authentic selves. We provide extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, building both employee competence and organizational capability to fuel exceptional performance through an inclusive environment both now and in the future. DUTIES: Work in an agile environment within a DEVOPS team; Model scalable BI solutions that help deliver quick insights; Run ad-hoc analyses to help drive projects and key business initiatives forward; Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements which includes automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing data model for greater scalability and performance; Diagnose and troubleshoot issues in real-time to provide guidance on necessary updates in code and UI; Perform data validations and QA of own work and the work of team members as required; Document business logic, program code and track changes to enable cross training and usability; Own projects and processes end to end as required, to help manage product support independently; Utilize SSIS, Excel, and other in-house tools/functions to Extract Transform, Load and analyze data with built in exception handling; Work with Analytics leadership, product management and development teams to elicit, analyze, and document user requirements, translating them into user stories; Collaborate with the Product Managers and other stakeholders to ensure health of the product backlog; Own the lifecycle of one or more products built by the team; Participate in Agile ceremonies, facilitating the discussion during planning and user story refinement; Provide reasonable estimates for work products; Collaborate with development team and ensure the design meets user requirements; Provide timely answers to team questions during design, development, and QA testing; Create SQL statements and analyze the resultant data; triage discrepancies found during the QA process; Field questions from stakeholders/end users during user acceptance testing, identify potential options to aid in the resolution process; Work with business owners and technical architects to set a strategic product direction and scope out project efforts; Follow established procedures and recommend new procedures for team standards; Utilize and evaluate metrics to identify and implement improvements to standards and procedures; Establish working relationships with stakeholders and build rapport to become a trusted advisor; Leverage available tools & templates to develop detailed work plans and status reports; Appropriately make difficult trade-offs on time and resources when faced with conflicting demands and high priority deadlines; and Communicate project expectations, updates and potential risks to team members and all stakeholders, while providing appropriate resolution/recommendations. MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: This position requires a Master's degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Math, Computer Science, Business, Management, or directly related field of study and 3 years related experience. Must also have each of the following (which may have been gained concurrently): (1) 3 years experience in leading requirement analysis, evaluating application and business process impacts, and assessing cross-application dependencies; (2) 3 years experience in writing SQL queries, analyzing data outputs, troubleshooting validation discrepancies, and addressing stakeholder inquiries during UAT; (3) 2 years experience working in Agile environments including gathering, analyzing, documenting, and translating requirements into user stories and tasks; (4) 2 years experience in Power BI datasets, including data aggregation, filtering, and sorting; (5) 2 years experience in designing conceptual, logical, and physical data models to organize, structure, and interpret complex datasets in alignment with business requirements; and (6) 2 years experience in translating complex business concepts into clear and concise language. In the alternative, the employer will accept a Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Economics, Math, Computer Science, Business, Management, or directly related field of study and 5 years related experience. Must also have each of the following (which may have been gained concurrently): (1) 5 years experience in leading requirement analysis, evaluating application and business process impacts, and assessing cross-application dependencies; (2) 5 years experience in writing SQL queries, analyzing data outputs, troubleshooting validation discrepancies, and addressing stakeholder inquiries during UAT; (3) 2 years experience working in Agile environments including gathering, analyzing, documenting, and translating requirements into user stories and tasks; (4) 2 years experience in Power BI datasets, including data aggregation, filtering, and sorting; (5) 2 years experience in designing conceptual, logical, and physical data models to organize, structure, and interpret complex datasets in alignment with business requirements; and (6) 2 years experience in translating complex business concepts into clear and concise language. Salary: $141,773 to $160.000/year. Full-time, position located in Irving, TX. Hybrid position. Must reside within commuting distance from the employer's Irving, TX office. Various unanticipated locations throughout the U.S. Please apply online at https://careers.vizientinc.com/careers. This position is also incentive eligible. Vizient has a comprehensive benefits plan! Please view our benefits here: http://www.vizientinc.com/about-us/careers Equal Opportunity Employer: Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The Company is committed to equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender identity, ethnicity, age, national origin, sexual orientation, disability status, veteran status or any other category protected by applicable law.
company_description: Vizient is the largest member-driven health care performance improvement company in the country.
parsed_skills: agile, excel, leadership, power bi, scalability, sql, statistics

title: Business Analyst
description: Closely align with the company's strategic goals, provide in-depth business analysis support, and drive the achievement of key business objectives through data insights. Deeply understand business logic and pain points, independently initiate and lead in-depth special analysis projects. Conduct exploratory data analysis to accurately attribute short-term anomalies and deeply interpret long-term trends; keenly identify business problems and growth opportunities, and use qualitative and quantitative analysis methods to deliver actionable insights and recommendations. Integrate market research, industry trends, and internal data to systematically identify core business pain points, and output forward-looking opportunity strategies and solutions. Build business-supporting databases, continuously advance the business digitalization process, and ensure data dimensions are clean, accurate, comprehensive, and efficiently usable for the business. Proactively promote and lead in-depth cross-departmental collaboration, and through effective communication and influence, ensure data analysis conclusions are effectively transformed into business actions, while driving the continuous optimization and closed-loop implementation of strategies. Requirements Bachelor's degree or above from a well-known university, or background in reputable internet/technology companies, with more than 5 years of business analysis experience. High stability, with experience in delivering multiple mature projects in the past; experience in driving 0-to-1 projects is a plus. Proficient in SQL, Excel, and mainstream BI tools; skilled in using Python/R for data analysis and modeling; able to independently complete high-quality, persuasive business analysis reports/insight PPTs and effectively drive business decisions. Possess excellent business acumen, business sensitivity, and curiosity; good at thinking about problems from the perspective of the overall situation and the essence of the business. Possess excellent data visualization, summarization, and upward/cross-departmental reporting skills; able to clearly explain complex analysis logic and business value. Possess the ability to independently obtain, integrate, and verify data from multiple channels (internal and external), without solely relying on existing data platforms. Possess excellent project promotion capabilities, cross-team collaboration skills, and influence; able to independently promote the effective implementation of analysis conclusions and strategies in business operations. Proficient in Mandarin, capable of conducting daily work conversations.

title: Analyst - FM Advisory
description: Make your next move an expert one. At Colliers it's not our success that sets us apart, it's how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what's right for our clients, people and communities. Why Colliers? Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers' continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career. About you As the FM Advisory Analyst, you are responsible for supporting the efficient and cost-effective operation of an organization's facilities. This role involves collecting, analyzing, and reporting on facilities-related data, assisting in strategic planning, and ensuring that facilities are maintained and optimized to support the organization's operational goals. You will collaborate with internal teams, suppliers, and external stakeholders to ensure smooth day-to-day operations, improve performance, and implement best practices in facilities management. In this role, you will… Data Analysis & Reporting: Collect, organize, and analyze data related to building operations, including facilities management, asset maintenance, and budget tracking. Prepare reports, presentations, and dashboards for management. Identify trends, inefficiencies, or potential risks and recommend corrective actions. Budgeting & Cost Control: Assist in the development and management of the organization's facilities budget, including tracking expenses, forecasting future costs, and finding opportunities for cost savings. Review supplier contracts and service agreements to ensure compliance with budgetary guidelines. Supplier Management: Support the selection, coordination, and management of external service providers (e.g., cleaning, maintenance, security). Track service performance, resolve any issues, and ensure compliance with contractual agreements. Communication and Project Management: Coordinate and communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, suppliers, and leadership. Support project planning, scheduling, and tracking of facilities initiatives. Prepare and deliver presentations, status updates, and project documentation while ensuring alignment of facilities projects with organizational priorities, timelines, and budgets. Solution Development: Identify opportunities for operational improvements that enhance client satisfaction and retention. Contribute to proposals, bids, and presentations for new business opportunities. Support relationship management with external clients and service providers while providing financial analyses and market insights to help expand FM service offerings. Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with leadership to align facilities strategy with overall business growth objectives. Identify and recommend improvements in facilities management processes, technology, and systems to enhance operational efficiency, sustainability, and tenant satisfaction. What success looks like Bachelor's degree in business administration, economics or related area. 5 years of relevant work experience in facilities management analysis Commercial Real Estate experience required Ability to guide the exchange of sensitive, complicated, and difficult information, convey performance expectations and handle problems. In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Office products Exceptional analytical skills; strong ability to think through range of possibilities and scenarios. Extensive organizational skills with a strong inquisitive mindset. Benefits Employees (and their families) are provided options for employer subsidized medical benefits including RX, dental, vision as well as employer paid basic life/AD&D insurance and short-term/long-term disability. Employees are able to enroll in our company's 401k plan, which includes an employer match. Employees will also receive 10 days of sick leave and a minimum of 15-days vacation annually. Certain senior-level roles are eligible for unlimited time off. Employees will also enjoy 10 paid holidays plus two personal flex days throughout the calendar year. Twelve weeks (for birth parents) and 4 weeks (for non-birth parents, including adoptive/foster parents) of paid parental leave will also be available for use after successful completion of 90 days of employment. Individuals may be eligible for different or additional benefits under applicable state law. Bonus This position is eligible for an annual bonus, based on company and individual performance. For Salary Roles Approximate Salary Range for Role: $75,000 to $82,982 Area/Location Specific: WFH USA Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on this job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Colliers International provides equal employment opportunity to all persons. No employee or applicant for employment will be discriminated against because of race, creed, origin, marital status, sexual orientation, age, otherwise qualified disabled or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. #LI-AC1 #LI-Remote Make your next move an expert one and join us as we lead the industry into the future. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. The employer will not sponsor applicants for work visas. Applications will be accepted on an ongoing basis. Direct applicants only please, no agencies. Colliers respects diversity and is an equal opportunity employer. No employee or applicant for employment will be discriminated against on the basis of any actual or perceived membership in any protected category including race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, related medical conditions and lactation), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances. If you are a qualified applicant who requires reasonable accommodation to complete a job application, pre-employment testing, a job interview or to otherwise participate in the hiring process, please contact accommodations@colliers.com for assistance.
